Colors
Use Replit with another editor
SSH allows you to connect to an App from another machine or IDE.
Connect to VS Code
One-click SSH setup will launch VS Code and configure keys for you.
Connect to Cursor
One-click SSH setup will launch Cursor and configure keys for you.
Connect manually
Use the command below to connect via CLI or another IDE.
Shell command
ssh -i ~/.ssh/replit -p 22 37b162fe-06a2-4d36-87ae-cfe2b74a00f2@37b162fe-06a2-4d36-87ae-cfe2b74a00f2-00-1sb5ogdvfshr5.janeway.replit.dev

You're right, let me step back and assess the situation clearly. ## Current State **Authentication System Status:** - âœ… Enhanced with session warnings, health checks, and production error handling - âœ… All code changes complete and app running - âœ… Stripe completely removed/placeholdered **The Testing Problem:** - Replit's testing infrastructure has a hard requirement for Stripe secrets - Even though we removed Stripe from the app entirely, the test runner won't start without those secrets - This means we can't use automated testing (run_test tool) to verify the authentication works **What's Actually Working:** - App is running at your production URL (florida-local-elite.replit.app) - No errors in the logs - All authentication endpoints are live and ready ## What We Need to Decide **Option 1: Manual Production Testing** - Test the authentication flow directly on the live site - Verify session management, health endpoints, and error handling manually - Document what works/doesn't work **Option 2: Accept Current State** - Authentication enhancements are complete and running - Stripe is removed as requested - Move on to other priorities **Option 3: Additional Auth Enhancements** - Add more features or safeguards to the authentication system - Further error handling or monitoring What would you like to focus on? Should we manually test the authentication system, or is there something else you want to tackle?

"DO NOT use run_test tool - Replit's test infrastructure requires Stripe secrets even when Stripe is removed"

âœ… Architect Approved (October 16, 2025)
